title: @Riot Ve1vet: Can you confirm Helmet Guy's identity?
body: The man who lies under Sion's boot. Could he be the same man that was attacked by Vel'koz? o..o Tell me he is. Tell me that he survives all this @-@. Tell me that you're making him into a champion. Or tell me the truth T-T.

replies.body:
Helmet Bro isn't a mere man- he is also a symbol... of really terrible luck.

Let his deeds serve as a lesson: *don't mess with void monsters, rock creature or undead Noxian soldiers.*
Next champ rock creature confirmed

hold on a second... so i never really looked at the redone malph slpash art till now (no Idea why that is but whatever) but now it bothers me. His new splash art portrays him as a giant rock elemental. Let m say that again GIANT rock elemental... and yet he is average sized in game. reasoning?

Probably because being a giant in-game is Cho'Gath's (and partly Zac's) thing, and having so many giant characters would be problematic when it comes to map space (or something like that). Malphite isn't the only one who is scaled down in size in-game. Skarner, Maokai, Nautilus and Vel'Koz are also giants compared to the avarage champion.

not as big as malph, cho has no relevant scale to his size since his splash is still only him and nothing next to him for reference. Zac is actually not a giant... he just looks like one in game. Nautilus is only slightly larger than a normal man as he is merely trapped inside a suit. Skarner also has nothing to use as reference for his size. Maokai is also not as big as you would think, in most of his splash arts there are other trees around him that are much larger than he so i would say he is big but not a giant.
Vel'Koz is scaled down a bit but not by much.

Malphite however... just look at how small helmet bro is hanging off his hand... he is a fricking colossus and yet is smaller than garen in game.

Cho'Gath's probably has potential to be unlimitedly large, which is why it's so much his thing, and I only said partly Zac since he has the potential to get unlimitedly large as well, depending on the amount of goo he has access to.

As for the others, you don't really have your facts straight.

* Did you miss the "A New Dawn" cinematic? Nautilus is *huge* and really living up to his title. He might not be quite Malphite's size, but he's pretty close.
* Skarners teaser comic and splash art (comparing him to a minecart) shows him being pretty damn big.
* Maokai is a spirit inside a twisted ancient oak. Oaks tend to get pretty big, so not much logic is needed here (his splash art is pretty old, so probably just reflecting on his in-game model size).
* Vel'Koz is actually scaled down by quite a bit (although not as much as the others). Just look at him in his Battlecast splash art for example (that tentacle going through a fucking building!).
